    • Method Detail

      • indexStopWords

        public void indexStopWords(java.lang.String stopWordsFile)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        stopWordsFile - creates a set of stopwords by scanning the file specified by the stopWordsFile String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • indexDocuments

        public void indexDocuments(java.util.List<java.lang.String> docNames)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        docNames - Iterates through a list of Strings of document names and passes in the TreeMap invertedIndex for each document, ensuring that all of their words (that aren’t stop words) are added and the document is accounted for under that word.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setup

        public void setup(java.lang.String stopWords,
                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> idxThese)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        stopWords - - the filename of the list of words to be ignored when indexing
        idxThese - - the documents to be added to the inverted index This method uses the indexStopWords and indexDocuments methods to add to the Set of stopwords and the Set of indexed words. It adds the stopwords first to know what to ignore when indexing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • respondToQuery

        public java.lang.String respondToQuery(java.lang.String queryWords)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        queryWords - - the query entered by the user creates a new Query object and passes queryWords in. Then passes in the invertedIndex into the Query object’s findWordInSet method to get the list of Documents. Uses the returned list of Documents and the printDocs boolean to get a proper String of documents and their contents. This is the piece that gets returned to the CLI and is displayed for the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
